snippet: The Federal Reserve opened a new chapter in its efforts to stimulate the American economy, saying that it intends to buy large quantities of mortgage bonds until the job market improves substantially.
abstract: Federal Reserve opens new chapter in its efforts to stimulate the economy, saying that it intends to buy large quantities of mortgage bonds and other assets until the job market improves substantially; move marks first time the Fed has tied the duration of an aid program to its economic objectives; Fed makes clear that its primary reason is not a deterioration in its economic outlook, but a determination to respond more forcefully.

byline.contributor: Nathaniel Popper contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve opened a new chapter in its efforts to stimulate the American economy, saying that it intends to buy large quantities of mortgage bonds until the job market improves substantially.

headline.seo: Fed Pledges Action Until Economy Shows Gains
headline.main: Fed Ties New Aid to Jobs Recovery in Forceful Move
headline.print_headline: Fed Links New Aid To Jobs Recovery In Forceful Move
